subject: Fashion
title: The Clothing Rental Economy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Clothing Rental Economy.

hook.text: Why own a dress you'll wear once when you can rent it for a fraction of the price?

buildup.text: Rent the Runway launched in 2009 with a radical pitch: access over ownership for designer fashion.

discovery.text: Rental extends each garment's active life, cutting the demand for new production by up to 24%.

twist.text: But shipping, dry cleaning, and packaging for each rental adds its own carbon footprint.

climax.text: Rental works for occasion wear. For everyday clothes, the logistics can erase the environmental gains.

punchline.text: Rent, don't buyâ€”unless the shipping costs more carbon.

quiz.question: What is a major environmental limitation of the clothing rental model?
options: Rented garments cannot be cleaned between uses for hygiene reasons
Shipping, dry cleaning, and packaging for each rental add significant carbon emissions
Rental companies must destroy garments after five uses for quality control
